Class Scene_Properties

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
com.example.demo.Scene_Manipulator.Scene_Properties
Direct Known Subclasses:
LevelBoss, LevelOne, LevelTwo, MainMenu
public abstract class Scene_Properties extends Observable
Abstract class that defines the properties and behaviors for a game scene. It handles the initialization of game elements, user and enemy interactions, background setup, pause functionality, and transitions between game states.

  • Constructor Details

    • Scene_Properties

      public Scene_Properties(String backgroundImageName, double screenHeight, double screenWidth, int playerInitialHealth)
      Constructor that initializes the basic properties of the game scene, including background, user plane, and game elements such as friendly and enemy units, projectiles, and pause settings.
      Parameters:
      backgroundImageName - the name of the background image
      screenHeight - the height of the game screen
      screenWidth - the width of the game screen
      playerInitialHealth - the initial health of the user plane

  • Method Details

    • stopMusic

      public void stopMusic()

    • initializeFriendlyUnits

      protected abstract void initializeFriendlyUnits()
      Abstract method for initializing the friendly units (player and allies).

    • checkIfGameOver

      protected abstract void checkIfGameOver()
      Abstract method to check if the game is over.

    • spawnEnemyUnits

      protected abstract void spawnEnemyUnits()
      Abstract method for spawning enemy units.

    • instantiateLevelView

      protected abstract Level_Interface instantiateLevelView()
      Abstract method for instantiating the level-specific view.
      Returns:
      the level-specific view

    • initializeScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene initializeScene()
      Initializes the scene, including background, friendly units, and level-specific UI.
      Returns:
      the game scene

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the game by playing a fade-in animation and starting the timeline.

    • goToNextLevel

      public void goToNextLevel(String levelName)
      Goes to the next level by notifying observers with the level name.
      Parameters:
      levelName - the name of the next level

    • initializeBackground

      private void initializeBackground()
      Initializes the background image and sets up key event listeners for player movement and actions.

    • togglePause

      private void togglePause()
      Toggles the pause state of the game. If the game is paused, it resumes the game and hides the pause overlay and menu. If the game is running, it pauses the game and shows the pause overlay and menu.

    • initializeTimeline

      private void initializeTimeline()
      Initializes the game timeline for the game loop. The game loop updates the scene at a fixed interval (MILLISECOND_DELAY).

    • fireProjectile

      private void fireProjectile()
      Fires a projectile from the user plane. The projectiles fired are added to the scene and the userProjectiles list.

    • generateEnemyFire

      private void generateEnemyFire()
      Generates enemy fire by iterating through all enemy units and spawning their projectiles.

    • spawnEnemyProjectile

      private void spawnEnemyProjectile(ActiveActorDestructible projectile)
      Spawns a projectile for an enemy and adds it to the scene and enemy projectiles list.
      Parameters:
      projectile - The projectile to spawn.

    • updateActors

      private void updateActors()
      Updates all actors in the game, including friendly units, enemy units, user projectiles, and enemy projectiles.

    • removeDestroyedActors

      private void removeDestroyedActors(List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors)
      Removes any destroyed actors from the scene and clears them from the actor lists.
      Parameters:
      actors - The list of actors to check for destruction.

    • removeAllDestroyedActors

      private void removeAllDestroyedActors()
      Removes all destroyed actors from the scene and clears them from the actor lists.

    • handlePlaneCollisions

      private void handlePlaneCollisions()
      Handles collisions between friendly units and enemy units.

    • handleUserProjectileCollisions

      private void handleUserProjectileCollisions()
      Handles collisions between user projectiles and enemy units.

    • handleEnemyProjectileCollisions

      private void handleEnemyProjectileCollisions()
      Handles collisions between enemy projectiles and friendly units.

    • handleCollisions

      private void handleCollisions(List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors1, List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors2)
      Generic collision handler between two lists of actors. When two actors intersect, both take damage.
      Parameters:
      actors1 - The first list of actors.
      actors2 - The second list of actors.

    • handleEnemyPenetration

      private void handleEnemyPenetration()
      Handles situations where enemy units have penetrated the user's defenses. The user takes damage when an enemy unit passes beyond the screen.

    • updateLevelView

      private void updateLevelView()
      Updates the level view, including removing hearts if the user's health decreases.

    • enemyHasPenetratedDefenses

      private boolean enemyHasPenetratedDefenses(ActiveActorDestructible enemy)
      Checks if an enemy unit has penetrated the user's defenses.
      Parameters:
      enemy - The enemy unit to check.
      Returns:
      True if the enemy has penetrated the defenses, otherwise false.

    • winGame

      protected void winGame()
      Handles winning the game, including stopping the timeline and displaying the win image.

    • loseGame

      protected void loseGame()
      Handles losing the game, including stopping the timeline and displaying the game over image.

    • getUser

      protected UserPlane getUser()
      Returns the user's plane object.
      Returns:
      The UserPlane object.

    • getRoot

      protected javafx.scene.Group getRoot()
      Returns the root group for the scene.
      Returns:
      The root group.

    • getCurrentNumberOfEnemies

      protected int getCurrentNumberOfEnemies()
      Returns the current number of enemy units in the game.
      Returns:
      The size of the enemy units list.

    • addEnemyUnit

      protected void addEnemyUnit(ActiveActorDestructible enemy)
      Adds an enemy unit to the list and scene.
      Parameters:
      enemy - The enemy unit to add.

    • getTimeline

      protected javafx.animation.Timeline getTimeline()
      Provides access to the game timeline for subclass use.
      Returns:
      The timeline object.

    • getEnemyMaximumYPosition

      protected double getEnemyMaximumYPosition()
      Returns the maximum Y position for enemy units, which is the screen height minus an adjustment.
      Returns:
      The enemy's maximum Y position.

    • getScreenWidth

      public double getScreenWidth()
      Returns the screen width.
      Returns:
      The screen width.

    • updateNumberOfEnemies

      private void updateNumberOfEnemies()
      Updates the current number of enemy units.

    • userIsDestroyed

      protected boolean userIsDestroyed()
      Checks if the user has been destroyed.
      Returns:
      True if the user is destroyed, otherwise false.

    • getScreenHeight

      protected double getScreenHeight()
      Returns the screen height.
      Returns:
      The screen height.

    • getEnemyUnits

      protected List<ActiveActorDestructible> getEnemyUnits()
      Returns the list of enemy units in the game.
      Returns:
      The list of enemy units.

    • getFriendlyUnits

      protected List<ActiveActorDestructible> getFriendlyUnits()
      Returns the list of friendly units in the game.
      Returns:
      The list of friendly units.

    • updateProjectiles

      public void updateProjectiles()
      Updates the projectiles in the game, removing any that are no longer alive.

    • showRetryButton

      private void showRetryButton()
      Displays the retry button on the screen.

    • resetGame

      private void resetGame()
      Resets the game state, clearing all actors and starting over from level 1.

    • updateKillCount

      private void updateKillCount()
      Updates the kill count, showing the number of enemies defeated.

    • updateScene

      private void updateScene()
      Updates the game scene by spawning enemy units, updating actors, handling collisions, and checking if the game is over.

    • initializePauseMenu

      private void initializePauseMenu()
      Initializes the pause menu, which includes resume, restart, and quit buttons.
